# This is Bad Bunny — thisisbadbunny.com

> An interactive platform documenting the career, discography, awards, concerts, and cultural impact of Bad Bunny (Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio), the Puerto Rican reggaeton artist who became a global icon.

## About the Artist

- Full name: Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio
- Stage name: Bad Bunny
- Born: March 10, 1994
- Birthplace: Bayamón, Puerto Rico (raised in Almirante Sur, Vega Baja)
- Genres: Reggaeton, Latin Trap, Latin Pop, Música Urbana
- Notable: Grammy Album of the Year winner (2026), Super Bowl LX halftime show headliner
- Most-streamed artist on Spotify (2020, 2021, 2022, 2023)

## Key Pages

- Homepage: https://thisisbadbunny.com
- Career Timeline: https://thisisbadbunny.com/trajectory
- Discography: https://thisisbadbunny.com/discography
- Awards: https://thisisbadbunny.com/awards
- Interviews: https://thisisbadbunny.com/interviews
- Concerts: https://thisisbadbunny.com/concerts
- About: https://thisisbadbunny.com/about

## Discography (Studio Albums)

1. X 100PRE (2018)
2. OASIS (2019) — with J Balvin
3. YHLQMDLG (2020)
4. Las que no iban a salir (2020)
5. El Último Tour Del Mundo (2020)
6. Un Verano Sin Ti (2022)
7. nadie sabe lo que va a pasar mañana (2023)
8. DeBí TiRAR MáS FOToS (2025) — Grammy Album of the Year 2026

## Awards Highlights

- 6 Grammy Awards, including Album of the Year (2026) for DeBí TiRAR MáS FOToS and Best Global Musical Performance
- First Spanish-language album to win Grammy Album of the Year
- 17 Latin Grammy Awards, including Album of the Year (2025) for DeBí TiRAR MáS FOToS
- 16 Billboard Music Awards
- 54 Billboard Latin Music Awards
- MTV VMA Artist of the Year (2022)
- Most-streamed artist on Spotify four consecutive years (2020–2023)
- IFPI Global Recording Artist of the Year (2022)
- Multiple Guinness World Records

## Site Details

- Languages: Spanish (primary), English
- Built with: Next.js, React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Prisma
- Content type: Bilingual editorial content, structured data, interactive timelines
- Data: Album metadata, track listings, award records, concert dates, interview archives
